endpoints_summary.summary: List all project snapshot aggregated issues
List all project snapshot issue paths

details.description:
#### Required permissions
- `View Organization`
- `View Project`
- `View Project Snapshot`

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID the project belongs to. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID the project belongs to. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID the project belongs to. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID.

details.description:
Deactivating a project will:
- Disable pull request tests for new vulnerabilities.
- Disable Fix pull request from being opened for newly disclosed vulnerabilities.
- Disable recurring tests - email alerts about newly disclosed vulnerabilities will be turned off.
- If the repository has no other active projects, then remove any webhooks related to the project.
#### Required permissions
- `View Organization`
- `View Project`
- `Project Status`

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID the project belongs to. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID.

details.description:
Activating a project will:
- Add a repository webhook for supported integrations.
- Enable pull request tests for new vulnerabilities.
- Open Fix pull request for newly disclosed vulnerabilities.
- Enable recurring tests, sending email alerts about newly disclosed vulnerabilities.
#### Required permissions
- `View Organization`
- `View Project`
- `Project Status`

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID the project belongs to. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID to return issues for.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID for which to return issue paths.

parameters.name: issueId
parameters.description: The issue ID for which to return issue paths.

parameters.name: snapshotId
parameters.description: The project snapshot ID for which to return issue paths. If set to `latest`, the most recent snapshot will be used. Use the "List all project snapshots" endpoint to find suitable values for this.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to return per page (1 - 1000, inclusive).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to return.

details.description:
#### Required permissions
- `View Organization`
- `View Project`
- `View Project Snapshot`

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID to return snapshots for.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to return (the default is 10, the maximum is 100).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The offset from which to start returning results from.

200.description:
* A reference implementation of the graph, as well as conversion functions to/from legacy tree format, can be found at: https://github.com/snyk/dep-graph.
* The object might contain additional fields in the future, in a backward-compatible way (`schemaVersion` will change accordingly).

details.description:
Ignores from `.snyk` files are not included here.
Ignores from Policies are not included here.
Temporary ignores include an `expires` attribute, while permanent ignores do not.
#### Required permissions
- `View Organization`
- `View Project`
- `View Project Ignores`

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID to list ignores for. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID to list ignores for.

details.description:
It is possible to modify/retrieve ignored vulnerability or license issues for a given organization and project.
Ignores from `.snyk` files are not included here
#### Required permissions
- `View Project`
- `View Project Ignores`

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID to modify ignores for. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID to modify ignores for.

parameters.name: issueId
parameters.description: The issue ID to modify ignores for. Can be a vulnerability or a license Issue.

details.description:
It is possible to modify/retrieve ignored vulnerability or license issues for a given organization and project.
Ignores from `.snyk` files are not included here
#### Required permissions
- `View Organization`
- `View Project Ignores`
- `Create new project ignores`

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The organization ID to modify ignores for. The `API_KEY` must have access to this organization.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project ID to modify ignores for.

parameters.name: issueId
parameters.description: The issue ID to modify ignores for. Can be a vulnerability or a license Issue.

links.title: links

paths.description: The URL for the dependency paths that introduce this issue

links.description: Onward links from this record (Non-IaC projects only)

created.description: The date that the snapshot was taken

totalDependencies.description: Number of dependencies of the project

allOf.description: Number of known vulnerabilities in the project, not including ignored issues
The method by which this snapshot was created.

severities.description: The severity levels of issues to filter the results by

exploitMaturity.description: The exploit maturity levels of issues to filter the results by (Non-IaC projects only)

types.description: The type of issues to filter the results by (Non-IaC projects only)

ignored.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are ignored, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not ignored

patched.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are patched, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not patched (Non-IaC projects only)

includeDescription.description: If set to `true`, Include issue's description, if set to `false` (by default), it won't (Non-IaC projects only)

includeIntroducedThrough.description: If set to `true`, include the dockerfile instruction that the issue is introducedThrough. If set to false (default), it won’t. This only applies to Container projects with an associated Dockerfile (CLI or Container Registry source)

snapshotId.description: The identifier of the snapshot for which the paths have been found

paths.description: A list of the dependency paths that introduce the issue

format.description: The standard by which the “maturity” value is shown

level.description: The exploit maturity of the issue

kind.description: The data kind, each data kind can have different data fields e.g. "ImageLayer"

data.description: The information about what introduced the issue. The data structure varies based on the data kind.

sources.description: The sources by which we determined the exploit maturity level

source.title: source
source.description: The place where the ignore rule was applied from

ignorePath.title: ignorePath

reason.description: The reason that the issue was ignored.

disregardIfFixable.description: Only ignore the issue if no upgrade or patch is available.

expires.description: The timestamp that the issue will no longer be ignored.

created.description: The timestamp that the issue was ignored.

ignorePath.description: The path that should be ignored. Wildcards can be specified with a `*`.

identifiers.title: identifiers

OSVDB.description: Identifiers assigned by the Open Source Vulnerability Database (OSVDB)

identifiers.description: External identifiers assigned to the issue (Non-IaC projects only)

pkgVersions.description: List of affected package versions (Non-IaC projects only)

introducedThrough.description: The list of what introduced the issue (it is available only for container project with Dockerfile)

isPatched.description: Whether the issue has been patched (Non-IaC projects only)

isIgnored.description: Whether the issue has been ignored

ignoreReasons.description: The list of reasons why the issue was ignored

allOf.description: Information about fix/upgrade/pinnable options for the issue (Non-IaC projects only)
Information about the priority of the issue (Non-IaC projects only)
Onward links from this record (Non-IaC projects only)

imageId.description: For container projects, filter by the ID of the image

score.title: score
score.description: Include issues where the priority score is between min and max

importingUser.title: importingUser
importingUser.description: The user who imported the project

fixInfo.title: fixInfo

isUpgradable.description: Whether all of the issue's paths are upgradable

isPinnable.description: Whether the issue can be fixed by pinning a transitive

isPatchable.description: Whether all the of issue's paths are patchable

isFixable.description: Whether all of the issue's paths are fixable. Paths that are already patched are not considered fixable unless they have an alternative remediation (e.g. pinning or upgrading). An upgrade path where the only changes are in transitive dependencies is only considered fixable if the package manager supports it.

isPartiallyFixable.description: Whether any of the issue's paths can be fixed. Paths that are already patched are not considered fixable unless they have an alternative remediation (e.g. pinning or upgrading).  An upgrade path where the only changes are in transitive dependencies is only considered fixable if the package manager supports it.

nearestFixedInVersion.description: Nearest version which includes a fix for the issue. This is populated for container projects only.

fixedIn.description: The set of versions in which this issue has been fixed. If the issue spanned multiple versions (i.e. `1.x` and `2.x`) then there will be multiple `fixedIn` entries

fixInfo.description: Information about fix/upgrade/pinnable options for the issue (Non-IaC projects only)

priority.title: priority

score.description: The priority score of the issue

factors.description: The list of factors that contributed to the priority of the issue

priority.description: Information about the priority of the issue (Non-IaC projects only)

owner.title: owner

id.description: A user to assign as the project owner.

owner.description: Set to `null` to remove all ownership. User must be a member of the same organization as the project.

priority1.title: priority1
priority1.description: The priority to filter the issues by (Non-IaC projects only)

severity.description: The severity status of the issue, after policies are applied

originalSeverity.description: The original severity status of the issue, as retrieved from Snyk Vulnerability database, before policies are applied

url.description: URL to a page containing information about the issue

description.example:
`## Overview
[`ms`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms) is a tiny millisecond conversion utility.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) due to an incomplete fix for previously reported vulnerability [npm:ms:20151024](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ms:20151024). The fix limited the length of accepted input string to 10,000 characters, and turned to be insufficient making it possible to block the event loop for 0.3 seconds (on a typical laptop) with a specially crafted string passed to `ms

allOf.description: External identifiers assigned to the issue (Non-IaC projects only)

credit.description: The list of people responsible for first uncovering or reporting the issue (Non-IaC projects only)

exploitMaturity.description: The exploit maturity of the issue

allOf.description: The ranges that are vulnerable and unaffected by the issue (Non-IaC projects only)

publicationTime.description: The date that the vulnerability was first published by Snyk (Non-IaC projects only)

disclosureTime.description: The date that the vulnerability was first disclosed

CVSSv3.description: The CVSS v3 string that signifies how the CVSS score was calculated (Non-IaC projects only)

cvssScore.description: The CVSS score that results from running the vector from `severities` with the highest CVSS version available.

severities.description: The list of cvssSources renamed to severities for issueData model

exploitDetails.description: The exploit maturity of the vulnerability in different industry-standard formats, as well as the sources of the information.

language.description: The language of the issue (Non-IaC projects only)

patches.description: A list of patches available for the given issue (Non-IaC projects only)

nearestFixedInVersion.description: Nearest version which includes a fix for the issue. This is populated for container projects only. (Non-IaC projects only)

path.description: Path to the resource property violating the policy within the scanned project. (IaC projects only)

violatedPolicyPublicId.description: The ID of the violated policy in the issue (IaC projects only)

isMaliciousPackage.description: Whether the issue is intentional, indicating a malicious package

issueCounts2.title: issueCounts2
issueCounts2.description: Number of known vulnerabilities in the project, not including ignored issues

upgrade.description:
Recommended upgrades to apply to the project
(object)
    + upgradeTo (string, required) - `package@version` to upgrade to
    + upgrades (array[string], required) -  List of `package@version` that will be upgraded as part of this upgrade
    + vulns (array[string], required) - List of vulnerability ids that will be fixed as part of this upgrade

patch.description:
Recommended patches to apply to the project
(object)
   paths (array) - List of paths to the vulnerable dependency that can be patched

pin.description:
Recommended pins to apply to the project (Python only)

(object)
    + upgradeTo (string, required) - `package@version` to upgrade to
    + vulns (array[string], required) - List of vulnerability ids that will be fixed as part of this upgrade
    + isTransitive (boolean) - Describes if the dependency to be pinned is a transitive dependency

urls.description: The URLs where the patch files can be downloaded

version.description: The version number(s) that the patch can be applied to

modificationTime.description: When the patch was last modified

issueId.description: The issue ID that should be ignored.

ignoredBy.title: ignoredBy

name.description: The name of the person who ignored the issue.

email.description: The email of the person who ignored the issue.

id.description: The user ID of the person who ignored the issue.

ignoredBy.description: The person who ignored the issue.

schemaVersion.description: The scheme version of the depGraph object

pkgs.description: A list of dependencies in the project

graph2.title: graph2

rootNodeId.description: The internal id of the root node

nodes.description: A list of the first-level packages

graph2.description: A directional graph of the packages in the project

reason.description: A reason why the issue was ignored

expires.description: The date when the ignore will no longer apply

allOf.description: The place where the ignore rule was applied from

snapshots.description: A list of the project's snapshots, ordered according to date (latest first).

branch.description: The branch that this project should be monitoring

ignorePath.description: The path to ignore (default is `*` which represents all paths).

reason.description: The reason that the issue was ignored.

disregardIfFixable.description: Only ignore the issue if no upgrade or patch is available.

expires.description: The timestamp that the issue will no longer be ignored.

created.description: The date that the project was created on

origin.description: The origin the project was added from

type.description: The package manager of the project

testFrequency.description: The frequency of automated Snyk re-test. Can be 'daily', 'weekly or 'never'

totalDependencies.description: Number of dependencies of the project

allOf.description: Number of known vulnerabilities in the project, not including ignored issues

imageId.description: For docker projects shows the ID of the image

imageTag.description: For docker projects shows the tag of the image

imageBaseImage.description: For docker projects shows the base image

imagePlatform.description: For docker projects shows the platform of the image

imageCluster.description: For Kubernetes projects shows the origin cluster name

hostname.description: The hostname for a CLI project, null if not set

remoteRepoUrl.description: The project remote repository url. Only set for projects imported via the Snyk CLI tool.

lastTestedDate.description: The date on which the most recent test was conducted for this project

owner.description:
The user who owns the project, null if not set

{
    "id": "e713cf94-bb02-4ea0-89d9-613cce0caed2",
    "name": "example-user@snyk.io",
    "username": "exampleUser",
    "email": "example-user@snyk.io"
}

allOf.description: The user who imported the project

isMonitored.description: Describes if a project is currently monitored or it is de-activated

targetReference.description: The identifier for which revision of the resource is scanned by Snyk. For example this may be a branch for SCM project, or a tag for a container image

assigner.description: The entity that assigned this CVSS vector

baseScore.description: The CVSS score that results from running the CVSS string (Non-IaC projects only)

vector.description: The CVSS string that signifies how the CVSS score was calculated (Non-IaC projects only)

cvssVersion.description: The CVSS version that is being described

modificationTime.description: The date severities was last modified

issueCountsBySeverity.title: issueCountsBySeverity
issueCountsBySeverity.description: Number of known vulnerabilities in the project, not including ignored issues

nodeId.description: The internal id of the node

deps.description: A list of the direct dependencies of the package

semver.title: semver

vulnerable.description: The ranges that are vulnerable to the issue. May be an array or a string.

unaffected.description: The ranges that are unaffected by the issue

semver.description: The ranges that are vulnerable and unaffected by the issue (Non-IaC projects only)

id.description: The internal id of the package

pkgManager2.title: pkgManager2

name.description: The name of the package manager

version.description: The version of the package manager

pkgManager2.description: The package manager of the project

method.title: method
method.description: The method by which this snapshot was created.

prev.description: The URL of the previous page of paths for the issue, if not on the first page

next.description: The URL of the next page of paths for the issue, if not on the last page

last.description: The URL of the last page of paths for the issue
